children.value: CSS grid layout component to arrange direct child elements in a tiled grid layout.

<Grid width={[ 128, null, 192 ]}>
  <Box bg='primary'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='muted'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='primary'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='muted'>Box</Box>
</Grid>

<Grid
  gap={2}
  columns={[ 2, null, 4 ]}>
  <Box bg='primary'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='muted'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='primary'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='muted'>Box</Box>
</Grid>

<Grid
  gap={2}
  columns={[2, '1fr 2fr']}>
  <Box bg='primary'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='muted'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='primary'>Box</Box>
  <Box bg='muted'>Box</Box>
</Grid>

component includes custom props for adjusting the grid layout.
Each prop can use the
Number of (equally-sized) columns, or string with
for the layout (cannot be used in conjunction with the
Mode for column sizing, used in conjunction with the
You can define additional CSS grid layouts by adding variants to the

object.
These styles can be used to create a wide variety of different reusable layouts.
